data.title: Barbara Burgo on Cape Cod and Cape Verde · Oral Histories of Falmouth · Digital Collections@Falmouth Public Library
data.text:
"We have just welcomed all of the elementary school second graders to the museum [...] and what we try to let them know is Cape Cod is so familiar to Cape Verdeans."

Barbara Burgo, co-founder of the Cape Cod Cape Verdean Museum and Cultural Center, discusses the many living links between Cape Verde and Cape Cod, with Troy Clarkson. This oral history interview was recorded on May 20, 2022 at Falmouth Community Television.

Ready to learn more? Explore our community resources:

From CLAMS:

Phoenix of the Seas, Chester Brigham

From Cape to Cape, Michael Whatley

Early Cape Verdean & Portuguese Genealogy of Harwich, MA, Amanda Raneo Chilaka

Between Race and Ethnicity: Cape Verdean American Immigrants, 1860-1965, Marilyn Halter

Across the Atlantic: An Anthology of Cape Verdean Literature, ed. Maria M. Ellen

Some Aspects of Cape Verdean Culture, Anthony D. Ramos, SPIA Media Productions
